variable.name: ADHVTYP
variable.description: Visit type for HRT adherence period

variable.name: ADHVY
variable.description: Visit year for HRT adherence period

variable.name: STARTDY
variable.description: Days from rand to start of HRT adherence period
variable.comment: Days from randomization to start of HRT adherence period.

variable.name: ENDDY
variable.description: Days from rand to end of HRT adherence period
variable.comment: Days from randomization to end of HRT adherence period.

variable.name: ADHRATE
variable.description: HRT medication adherence rate for the period

variable.name: COLLECT
variable.description: Was adherence collection performed during period
variable.comment: Were HRT pill bottles collected to allow adherence determination for period? If not, no adherence rate can be calculated.

variable.name: STOPHRT
variable.description: Participant inactive in HRT interventin during period
variable.comment: Was the participant inactive in the HRT intervention (i.e. not taking study pills) for all or part of the period.

variable.name: RESUMEHRT
variable.description: Participant resumed HRT intervention during period
variable.comment: Did the participant resume HRT intervention (start taking study pills) during this period after having stopped?

variable.name: LOST
variable.comment: Did the participant have a status of lost-to-follow-up during all or part of this HRT adherence period?

variable.name: DEAD
variable.comment: Did the participant have a status of deceased during all or part of this HRT adherence period?

variable.name: OPENLABEL
variable.description: Were open label HRT meds dispensed during period
variable.comment: Were any open label HRT medications dispensed to the participant during this period? Open label medications are not factored into the adherence rate calculation.

variable.name: ERT2PERT
variable.description: Participant was switched from E-alone to E+P in period
variable.comment: Participant was switched from the unopposed estrogen study group to the estrogen+progesterone study group during this period (January 1995), due to PEPI trial results indicating long-term adherence to estrogen was not feasible in women with a uterus.
